episodeTitle: Pirates Get On The Move! Astounding New World!
episodeTitleJapanese: 動き出す海賊たち！驚天動地の新世界
description: The Supernovas make their moves into the New World after the war at Marineford. Trafalgar Law and his crew discuss their journey, X Drake confronts Kaido's forces, Scratchmen Apoo battles giant wild boars, and Jewelry Bonney is captured by Blackbeard before Akainu arrives. Meanwhile, Chopper returns to his island to continue his medical research.

openingSong.title: Fight Together
openingSong.titleJapanese: ファイト・トゥギャザー

events.title: Trafalgar Law Near Sabaody Archipelago
events.description: Trafalgar Law and the Heart Pirates are shown near Sabaody Archipelago discussing their plans to enter the New World. The crew reflects on the recent events at Marineford and prepares for the challenges ahead.
events.significance: Shows Law's progression and foreshadows his importance in the New World arc. Establishes the Heart Pirates' journey into the second half of the Grand Line.

events.title: Scotch's First Appearance
events.description: X Drake encounters Scotch, a massive cyborg with a triple-barrel gun for a right hand, on a winter island in the New World. Scotch reveals he is a subordinate of Kaido and guards one of the Emperor's favorite islands where weapons are manufactured.
events.significance: First appearance of Scotch, one of Kaido's subordinates. Introduces the concept of Kaido's weapon manufacturing operations and foreshadows the Yonko's influence in the New World.

quotes.text: This island is a favorite of Kaido's and is under his protection.
quotes.speaker: Scotch
quotes.context: Warning X Drake about attacking the island

events.title: X Drake Challenges Kaido's Forces
events.description: X Drake asks Scotch if attacking him would gain Kaido's attention. When Scotch confirms it would, Drake transforms into his dinosaur form and prepares to battle the cyborg, deliberately trying to get noticed by the Emperor.
events.significance: Reveals Drake's strategy to infiltrate Kaido's organization by challenging his subordinates. This is part of Drake's undercover Marine operation that becomes important later in the story.

quotes.text: If I attack you, will that get Kaido's attention?
quotes.speaker: X Drake
quotes.context: Drake's intentional provocation to meet Kaido

events.title: Apoo Battles Giant Boars
events.description: Scratchmen Apoo and his On Air Pirates encounter enormous wild boars on an island in the New World. After defeating one boar, a massive herd stampedes toward them, forcing the crew to run.
events.significance: Demonstrates the increased dangers and unusual phenomena in the New World. Showcases Apoo's abilities and the challenges rookie pirates face in the second half of the Grand Line.

events.title: Apoo Runs on Air
events.description: While fleeing from the giant boar stampede, Apoo and his crew reach a cliff edge but continue running in midair, much to their own astonishment. The boars continue chasing them through the sky, revealing the island has invisible pathways.
events.significance: Reveals one of the New World's mysterious phenomena - invisible land or air paths. This creative visual plays on the crew's name 'On Air Pirates' and demonstrates the unpredictable nature of New World islands.

events.title: Jewelry Bonney Defeated by Blackbeard
events.description: The Blackbeard Pirates have defeated Jewelry Bonney and her crew. Blackbeard mocks Bonney, calling her too weak to survive in the New World and offering her the chance to join his crew as his woman, which she angrily refuses.
events.significance: Shows the power gap between the Supernovas and the Yonko-level pirates. Demonstrates Blackbeard's growing power and ruthlessness after acquiring Whitebeard's Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.text: You're too weak to survive. You're the first to be eliminated.
quotes.speaker: Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard)

events.title: Admiral Akainu Arrives
events.description: Van Augur spots Admiral Akainu commanding a Marine battleship approaching their location. The Blackbeard Pirates immediately decide to flee rather than risk confrontation with the Admiral, abandoning Bonney and her crew to be captured.
events.significance: Demonstrates that even the Blackbeard Pirates, despite their new power, are not ready to face a Marine Admiral head-on. Shows Akainu's post-war authority and the Marines' pursuit of pirates.

events.title: Akainu's Cryptic Warning to Bonney
events.description: Akainu confronts the shackled Jewelry Bonney and coldly tells her that he was truly frightened when she escaped from the World Government, but is glad she's back under their control. This reveals Bonney has a mysterious connection to the World Government.
events.significance: Major revelation that Jewelry Bonney has a special relationship with the World Government that goes beyond being a regular pirate. Akainu's fear of her escape suggests she holds dangerous secrets. This mystery becomes important much later in the story.

quotes.text: I was truly frightened when you escaped from the World Government, but I'm glad you're back under our control.
quotes.speaker: Akainu
quotes.context: Revealing Bonney's mysterious connection to the World Government

events.title: Chopper's 'Chopper Mask' Disguise
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper returns to the Birdie Kingdom island earlier than planned and attempts to disguise himself as 'Chopper Mask' to avoid being recognized. However, the giant birds and natives instantly see through his disguise, and he sheepishly removes it.
events.significance: A comedic moment showing Chopper's endearing naivety and his relationship with the island's inhabitants. Shows his dedication to returning to study medicinal plants to become stronger for the crew.

events.title: Chopper Commits to Training
events.description: Chopper visits the village library to study the island's medicinal plants. He reflects on Luffy's message and his own weaknesses during the war, deciding to stay on the island to improve both his medical knowledge and his strength to better serve his captain and crew.
events.significance: Character development moment for Chopper. Shows his determination to grow stronger during the two-year timeskip. Parallels the other Straw Hats' training decisions and demonstrates the crew's collective commitment to reuniting stronger.

themes.description: The episode showcases multiple Supernovas facing the harsh realities and increased dangers of the New World, from Yonko-level threats to bizarre environmental hazards.
themes.symbolism: The various challenges (cyborg guardians, giant boars, Blackbeard's crew) symbolize how the second half of the Grand Line is fundamentally more dangerous than Paradise.

themes.description: Chopper's decision to continue training parallels the broader theme of the Straw Hats preparing themselves during the timeskip to face New World challenges.
themes.symbolism: The library and medicinal research represent knowledge as power, and Chopper's commitment to improvement reflects the crew's collective determination.

themes.description: The episode establishes the power dynamics in the post-war world, with Yonko-level forces dominating and even powerful rookie pirates like Bonney being easily defeated.
themes.symbolism: Blackbeard fleeing from Akainu shows that even with two Devil Fruits, he's not yet ready to challenge the Marines' top forces.

characterSpotlights.development: Bonney's defeat and capture reveals her mysterious connection to the World Government, adding intrigue to her character while showing the dangers of the New World.
keyActions: Captured by Akainu and the Marines

characterSpotlights.development: Drake's deliberate provocation of Kaido's forces reveals his calculated approach to achieving his goals, foreshadowing his eventual infiltration of the Beasts Pirates.
keyActions: Transforms into dinosaur form for battle
quotes: If I attack you, will that get Kaido's attention?

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper shows maturity in recognizing his weaknesses and committing to improvement, both in medical knowledge and combat ability.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded X Drake's encounter with Scotch, showing more of the battle preparation and the winter island setting with additional visual details of the weapon manufacturing.
Scratchmen Apoo's battle with the giant boars was extended in the anime, showing more of the chase sequence and the moment when they discover they're running on air.

Chopper's return to Birdie Kingdom received additional character development scenes, including extended internal monologue about his determination to become stronger and reflections on Luffy's acceptance.

trivia.fact: Episode 513 adapts pages 3-15 of Chapter 595, titled 'The Pledge.' The remaining pages were adapted in Episode 514.
This episode marks the first appearance of Scotch, one of Kaido's Numbers/subordinates, foreshadowing the Yonko's influence in the New World years before the Wano arc.
The 'Chopper Mask' disguise is a comedic reference to Japanese superhero shows, particularly the 'Kamen Rider' (Masked Rider) franchise.

Akainu's statement about being 'frightened' when Bonney escaped from the World Government wouldn't be fully explained until much later in the manga, making it one of the series' longest-running mysteries.
Episode 513 aired on September 4, 2011 in Japan, but was simulcast on September 3, 2011 in the US due to time zone differences, making it available to American fans before Japanese broadcast.
This episode uses 'Fight Together' by Namie Amuro as the opening theme, which was the final opening of the first half of One Piece before the two-year timeskip.
